CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 14, 1961, pg. 1, reads: "YOUNG CRUSADERS - Carrying on a fight for fair employment which too often is ignored by Pittsburgh adults, these members of the local NAACP Youth Council are picketing shoe stores on downtown Fifth Ave., which do not hire Negro salesmen. Shown in foreground with the youngsters are, left to right: John Brice [sic] of the Minute Men Association, Mrs. Dorothy K. Williams, adviser to the youth group, and James McCoy, member of the the local NAACP board. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Protesters including John Grice, Dorothy K. Williams, James McCoy, and member of NAACP Youth Council, standing outside of Jarman shoe store with NAACP signs reading "Don't patronize Fifth Avenue Shoe Stores," Downtown
CatSubject_tab: Picketing--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Civil rights demonstrations--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Women--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Signs--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Sidewalks--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.National Association for the Advancement of Colored People.
